result.execSummary:
The defendant Rasaq Opeyemi Sowemimo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rasaq Opeyemi Sowemimo

defendant.name: Sowemimo, Rasaq Opeyemi
defendant.address: 1255 Cty Road D, Vadnais Heights, MN 55109

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Probation review hearing on June 12, 2017 at 11:45 am.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: 11:46 a.m. Defendant Rasaq Opeyemi Sowemimo in court with attorney Jens Hubert Loberg.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   State files Amended Information.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.    Constitutional rights explained to defendant.    Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.    DEF PLEADS GUILTY to Counts 1 and 2 of the Amended Information.    Facts are correct in the Amended Information.    COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.    The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of Count 1 and Count 2 of the Amended Information.  Court orders S/W, 1 year probation on each charge, concurrent, eligible for expungement upon successful completion of probation, River Falls Police Dept to return computer and cell phone, 100 hours of Community Service, $443 Court costs on Count 1 including DNA surcharge.   Court costs of $243 on Count 2.  Appeal rights are given to defendant.
Status conference on June 13, 2016 at 11:15 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 12, 2016 at 11:00 am.

02:13   Information Filed with the Court and a copy is given to the defendant.   Defendant has a copy of the information  and waives reading of the information.   Court reads charges and possible penalties.   Defendant enters not guilty plea at preliminary hearing.   Not guilty plea received by the court.   Pretrial Conference to be set.   The bond will continue as ordered and is reviewed with the defendant.  02:16

02:10 Defendant Rasaq Opeyemi Sowemimo in court with attorney Jens Hubert Loberg.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Written waiver of preliminary hearing is filed and the court reviews with the defendant.   Judge exams the defendant re the waiver of preliminary hearing.   Court finds defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to a preliminary hearing.   The court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for further proceedings.
Atty Jens Loberg has been retained.

4:12 Defendant Rasaq Opeyemi Sowemimo in court, in custody. Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Liesl Nelson appeared in court via phone. Previously the court read all defendants in the courtroom their rights in a group. Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.  Defendant waives reading of the complaint. Froelich requests a $3000 signature bond with a no contact provision. Nelson no objection to signature bond.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 11, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
